intro: Dinophora spenneroides subsp. montana, commonly known as the Montana dinophora, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, thriving in cooler, moist environments. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a distinctive silvery or grayish underside. The flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer, are small and white, attracting pollinators such as bees and flies.
